Cannoli Ice Cream Sandwiches

Jump to Recipe

Indulge in the delightful fusion of classic Italian flavors and modern ice cream treats with these Cannoli Ice Cream Sandwiches. Perfect for warm summer days or whenever you crave a sweet and creamy dessert, these sandwiches combine the crispy texture of cannoli shells with a rich and velvety filling made from ricotta cheese, chocolate chips, and your favorite ice cream. This easy-to-follow recipe is not only a hit at parties but also a fun way to impress friends and family with your culinary creativity. Whether you’re looking to elevate a simple dessert or enjoy a nostalgic treat with a twist, these Cannoli Ice Cream Sandwiches are sure to satisfy your sweet tooth. Let’s dive into this delicious recipe that brings together the best of both worlds!

Ingredients

cannoli shells

If you can't find pre-made cannoli shells, you can make your own using pastry dough shaped into tubes and fried until golden brown. Alternatively, use store-bought ice cream cones or waffle cones for a different texture.

ricotta cheese

Choose whole milk ricotta for a creamier texture. If you prefer a smoother filling, strain the ricotta through a cheesecloth for a few hours to remove excess moisture. You can substitute with mascarpone cheese for a richer flavor.

powdered sugar

Powdered sugar is essential for sweetness and a smooth texture. If you need a substitute, you can blend granulated sugar in a blender until fine, but keep in mind it won't dissolve as quickly as powdered sugar.

vanilla extract

For a more intense flavor, use pure vanilla extract instead of imitation. You can also substitute with almond extract for a unique twist, but use half the amount as almond extract is stronger.

chocolate chips

Use mini chocolate chips for easier filling and distribution in the ricotta mixture. You can also substitute with chopped dark chocolate, white chocolate, or even dried fruit like cherries or cranberries for a different flavor.

ice cream (your choice)

Choose a flavor that complements the ricotta and chocolate, like vanilla, chocolate, or hazelnut. For a healthier option, consider using frozen yogurt or sorbet. Allow the ice cream to soften slightly before scooping to make filling the cannoli shells easier.

Cooking Steps

  • Step 1: Prepare the Ricotta Mixture

    In a mixing bowl, combine 1 cup of ricotta cheese, 1/2 cup of powdered sugar, 1 teaspoon of vanilla extract, and 1/2 cup of chocolate chips. Mix until the mixture is smooth and creamy. Make sure to scrape down the sides of the bowl to incorporate all ingredients well.

  • Step 2: Fill the Cannoli Shells

    Take one cannoli shell and fill it with a generous scoop of your favorite ice cream (2 cups in total). Ensure that the ice cream is slightly softened for easier filling.

  • Step 3: Add the Ricotta Mixture

    Top the ice cream with a generous portion of the prepared ricotta mixture. Spread it evenly on top of the ice cream for a balanced flavor in every bite.

  • Step 4: Assemble the Sandwich

    Place another cannoli shell on top of the filled shell to create a sandwich. Press gently to ensure everything stays together.

  • Step 5: Repeat the Process

    Repeat the filling and assembling process with the remaining ingredients until all 12 cannoli shells are used and you have created 6 ice cream sandwiches.

  • Step 6: Serve or Freeze

    You can serve the cannoli ice cream sandwiches immediately for a soft treat, or if you prefer a firmer texture, freeze them for about 30 minutes before serving.

Frequently Asked Questions

What are cannoli shells and where can I find them?

Cannoli shells are crispy pastry tubes, traditionally filled with sweet ricotta filling. You can find them at Italian bakeries, grocery stores, or online. If you can't find them, you can make your own using a cannoli mold and dough.

How do I prepare ricotta cheese for the filling?

Simply spoon the ricotta cheese into a mixing bowl. If it's too thick, you can gently whip it with a fork or a hand mixer until creamy. This will help it combine better with the other ingredients.

What can I substitute for powdered sugar?

If you don't have powdered sugar, you can blend granulated sugar in a blender or food processor until it becomes a fine powder. However, for this recipe, using powdered sugar is recommended for its smooth texture.

How can I safely fill the cannoli shells?

Use a small spoon or a piping bag to fill the cannoli shells. Make sure to fill them gently to avoid breaking the shells. If the filling is too thick to pipe, you can add a little milk to loosen it.

How do I know when my ice cream sandwiches are ready to serve?

You can serve the ice cream sandwiches immediately after assembling them. If you prefer a firmer treat, freeze them for about 30 minutes. This will help the ice cream hold its shape better.

What type of ice cream works best for these sandwiches?

You can use any flavor of ice cream you like! Vanilla, chocolate, or even more adventurous flavors like pistachio or mint chocolate chip work well.

Can I make these sandwiches in advance?

Yes, you can prepare the ricotta filling and fill the cannoli shells in advance. Just store the filled sandwiches in an airtight container in the freezer for up to a week.

How do I store leftover cannoli ice cream sandwiches?

Wrap any leftover sandwiches in plastic wrap or place them in an airtight container. Store them in the freezer to keep them fresh.

Additional Information

Dietary Considerations

For gluten-free options, use gluten-free cannoli shells, which are available at many specialty stores. To make the dessert dairy-free, substitute the ricotta cheese with a dairy-free cream cheese alternative or a blended cashew cream, and opt for dairy-free ice cream. For a lower-sugar version, you can use a sugar substitute in the ricotta mixture and choose a low-sugar or no-sugar-added ice cream.

Pairings

These Cannoli Ice Cream Sandwiches pair beautifully with a rich espresso or a creamy cappuccino, enhancing the dessert experience with a delightful coffee contrast. For a more indulgent pairing, consider serving them with a glass of dessert wine, such as Vin Santo, which complements the sweet and creamy flavors. Additionally, a side of fresh berries, such as raspberries or strawberries, can provide a tart contrast that balances the sweetness of the sandwich.

Serving Suggestions

Serve the Cannoli Ice Cream Sandwiches on a chilled plate for an elegant presentation. You can dust the top with a light sprinkle of powdered sugar or cocoa powder for visual appeal. Garnish with fresh mint leaves or a drizzle of chocolate sauce to elevate the dessert further. For a fun touch, consider serving them with a small scoop of extra ice cream or a dollop of whipped cream on the side. If serving at a party, consider cutting the sandwiches in half for easy sharing and a more manageable portion size.

Cannoli Ice Cream Sandwiches

15 min
$15
350 kcal
Difficulty: 30%
Servings: 6

Allergens:

DairyGluten

Dietary Tags:

Vegetarian

Cuisine:

Italian

Course:

Dessert

Tags:

DessertEasyNo-Bake

Description

Delicious cannoli-inspired ice cream sandwiches filled with creamy ricotta and chocolate chips, perfect for a sweet treat!

Ingredients

  • cannoli shells: 12
  • ricotta cheese: 1 cup
  • powdered sugar: 1/2 cup
  • vanilla extract: 1 teaspoon
  • chocolate chips: 1/2 cup
  • ice cream (your choice): 2 cups
